childNodes.name: childNodes
childNodes.comment:
A list of this node's children.

Other resources

  • Node.childNodes from MDN.

firstChild.name: firstChild
firstChild.comment:
The first child of this node.

Other resources

  • Node.firstChild from MDN.

lastChild.name: lastChild
lastChild.comment:
The last child of this node.

Other resources

  • Node.lastChild from MDN.

nextNode.name: nextNode
nextNode.comment:
The next sibling node.

Other resources

  • Node.nextSibling from MDN.

nodeName.name: nodeName
nodeName.comment:
The name of this node.

This varies by this node's nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.nodeType.

Other resources

  • Node.nodeName from MDN. This page contains a table of nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.nodeName values for each nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.nodeType.

nodeType.name: nodeType
nodeType.comment:
The type of node.

This value is one of:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.ATTRIBUTE_NODE if this node is an attribute.
  • [CDATA_SECTION_NODE] if this node is a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.CDataSection.
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.COMMENT_NODE if this node is a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.Comment.
  • [DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT_NODE] if this node is a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.DocumentFragment.
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.DOCUMENT_NODE if this node is a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.Document.
  • [DOCUMENT_TYPE_NODE] if this node is a DocumentType node.
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.ELEMENT_NODE if this node is an nuxeo_api_playground/nx_structures_browser.Element.
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.ENTITY_NODE if this node is an entity.
  • [ENTITY_REFERENCE_NODE] if this node is an entity reference.
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.NOTATION_NODE if this node is a notation.
  • [PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION_NODE] if this node is a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.ProcessingInstruction.
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.TEXT_NODE if this node is a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.Text node.

Other resources

  • Node.nodeType from MDN.

nodeValue.name: nodeValue
nodeValue.comment:
The value of this node.

This varies by this type's nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.nodeType.

Other resources

  • Node.nodeValue from MDN. This page contains a table of nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.nodeValue values for each nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Node.nodeType.

ownerDocument.name: ownerDocument
ownerDocument.comment:
The document this node belongs to.

Returns null if this node does not belong to any document.

Other resources

  • Node.ownerDocument from MDN.

parent.name: parent
parent.comment:
The parent element of this node.

Returns null if this node either does not have a parent or its parent is not an element.

Other resources

  • Node.parentElement from W3C.

parentNode.name: parentNode
parentNode.comment:
The parent node of this node.

Other resources

  • Node.parentNode from MDN.

previousNode.name: previousNode
previousNode.comment:
The previous sibling node.

Other resources

  • Node.previousSibling from MDN.

text.name: text
text.comment:
All text within this node and its decendents.

Other resources

  • Node.textContent from MDN.

draggable.name: draggable
draggable.comment:
Indicates whether the element can be dragged and dropped.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

dropzone.name: dropzone
dropzone.comment:
A set of space-separated keywords that specify what kind of data this Element accepts on drop and what to do with that data.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

hidden.name: hidden
hidden.comment:
Indicates whether the element is not relevant to the page's current state.

Other resources

  • Hidden attribute specification from WHATWG.

translate.name: translate
translate.comment:
Specifies whether this element's text content changes when the page is localized.

Other resources

  • The translate attribute from WHATWG.

bindings.name: bindings
bindings.comment:
Gets the data bindings that are associated with this node, if any.

This starts out null, and if nuxeo_api_playground/template_binding.enableBindingsReflection is enabled, calls to nuxeo_api_playground/nx_structures_browser.HtmlElement+Polymer.bind will initialize this field and the binding.

$.comment: Map of items in the shadow root(s) by their nuxeo_api_playground/nx_batch.Element.id.

eventController.name: eventController
eventController.comment: Returns the object that should be used as the event controller for event bindings in this element's template. If set, this will override the normal controller lookup.

shadowRoots.name: shadowRoots
shadowRoots.comment:
Gets the shadow root associated with the corresponding custom element.

This is identical to shadowRoot, unless there are multiple levels of inheritance and they each have their own shadow root. For example, this can happen if the base class and subclass both have <template> tags in their <polymer-element> tags.

searchFilter.name: searchFilter
searchFilter.comment: searchFilter adds a delay to the searchTerm to prevent immediate changes to the results

innerHtml=.name: innerHtml=
innerHtml=.comment:
Parses the HTML fragment and sets it as the contents of this element.

This uses the default sanitization behavior to sanitize the HTML fragment, use nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.setInnerHtml to override the default behavior.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.comment:
All attributes on this element.

Any modifications to the attribute map will automatically be applied to this element.

This only includes attributes which are not in a namespace (such as 'xlink:href'), additional attributes can be accessed via nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.getNamespacedAttributes.

borderEdge.name: borderEdge
borderEdge.comment:
Access the dimensions and position of this element's content + padding + border box.

This returns a rectangle with the dimenions actually available for content in this element, in pixels, regardless of this element's box-sizing property. Unlike nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.getBoundingClientRect, the dimensions of this rectangle will return the same numerical height if the element is hidden or not. This can be used to retrieve jQuery's outerHeight value for an element.

Important note: use of this method will perform CSS calculations that can trigger a browser reflow. Therefore, use of this property during an animation frame is discouraged. See also: Browser Reflow

changes.name: changes
changes.comment:
The stream of change records to this object. Records will be delivered asynchronously.

nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-observable.Observable.deliverChanges can be called to force synchronous delivery.

children.name: children
children.comment:
List of the direct children of this element.

This collection can be used to add and remove elements from the document.

var item = new DivElement();
item.text = 'Something';
document.body.children.add(item) // Item is now displayed on the page.
for (var element in document.body.children) {
  element.style.background = 'red'; // Turns every child of body red.
}

classes.name: classes
classes.comment:
The set of CSS classes applied to this element.

This set makes it easy to add, remove or toggle the classes applied to this element.

element.classes.add('selected');
element.classes.toggle('isOnline');
element.classes.remove('selected');

client.name: client
client.comment: Gets the position of this element relative to the client area of the page.

contentEdge.name: contentEdge
contentEdge.comment:
Access this element's content position.

This returns a rectangle with the dimenions actually available for content in this element, in pixels, regardless of this element's box-sizing property. Unlike nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.getBoundingClientRect, the dimensions of this rectangle will return the same numerical height if the element is hidden or not.

Important note: use of this method will perform CSS calculations that can trigger a browser reflow. Therefore, use of this property during an animation frame is discouraged. See also: Browser Reflow

dataset.name: dataset
dataset.comment:
Allows access to all custom data attributes (data-*) set on this element.

The keys for the map must follow these rules:

  • The name must not begin with 'xml'.
  • The name cannot contain a semi-colon (';').
  • The name cannot contain any capital letters.

Any keys from markup will be converted to camel-cased keys in the map.

For example, HTML specified as:

<div data-my-random-value='value'></div>

Would be accessed in Dart as:

var value = element.dataset['myRandomValue'];

See also:

  • Custom data attributes

documentOffset.name: documentOffset
documentOffset.comment:
Provides the coordinates of the element relative to the top of the document.

This method is the Dart equivalent to jQuery's offset method.

element.name: element
element.comment: The most derived <polymer-element> declaration for this element.

hasObservers.name: hasObservers
hasObservers.comment: True if this object has any observers, and should call nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-observable.Observable.notifyChange for changes.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

marginEdge.name: marginEdge
marginEdge.comment:
Access the dimensions and position of this element's content + padding + border + margin box.

This returns a rectangle with the dimenions actually available for content in this element, in pixels, regardless of this element's box-sizing property. Unlike nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.getBoundingClientRect, the dimensions of this rectangle will return the same numerical height if the element is hidden or not. This can be used to retrieve jQuery's outerHeight value for an element.

Important note: use of this method will perform CSS calculations that can trigger a browser reflow. Therefore, use of this property during an animation frame is discouraged. See also: Browser Reflow

namespaceUri.name: namespaceUri
namespaceUri.comment:
A URI that identifies the XML namespace of this element.

null if no namespace URI is specified.

Other resources

  • Node.namespaceURI from W3C.

nodes.name: nodes
nodes.comment: A modifiable list of this node's children.

offset.name: offset
offset.comment: Gets the offset of this element relative to its offsetParent.

on.name: on
on.comment: This is an ease-of-use accessor for event streams which should only be used when an explicit accessor is not available.

onDrag.name: onDrag
onDrag.comment:
A stream of drag events fired when this element currently being dragged.

A drag event is added to this stream as soon as the drag begins. A drag event is also added to this stream at intervals while the drag operation is still ongoing.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

onDragEnd.name: onDragEnd
onDragEnd.comment:
A stream of dragend events fired when this element completes a drag operation.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

onDragEnter.name: onDragEnter
onDragEnter.comment:
A stream of dragenter events fired when a dragged object is first dragged over this element.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

onDragLeave.name: onDragLeave
onDragLeave.comment:
A stream of dragleave events fired when an object being dragged over this element leaves this element's target area.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

onDragOver.name: onDragOver
onDragOver.comment:
A stream of dragover events fired when a dragged object is currently being dragged over this element.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

onDragStart.name: onDragStart
onDragStart.comment:
A stream of dragstart events fired when this element starts being dragged.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

onDrop.name: onDrop
onDrop.comment:
A stream of drop events fired when a dragged object is dropped on this element.

Other resources

  • Drag and drop sample based on the tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Drag and drop specification from WHATWG.

paddingEdge.name: paddingEdge
paddingEdge.comment:
Access the dimensions and position of this element's content + padding box.

This returns a rectangle with the dimenions actually available for content in this element, in pixels, regardless of this element's box-sizing property. Unlike nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.getBoundingClientRect, the dimensions of this rectangle will return the same numerical height if the element is hidden or not. This can be used to retrieve jQuery's innerHeight value for an element. This is also a rectangle equalling the dimensions of clientHeight and clientWidth.

Important note: use of this method will perform CSS calculations that can trigger a browser reflow. Therefore, use of this property during an animation frame is discouraged. See also: Browser Reflow

preventDispose.name: preventDispose
preventDispose.comment: By default the data bindings will be cleaned up when this custom element is detached from the document. Overriding this to return true will prevent that from happening.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

shadowRoot.name: shadowRoot
shadowRoot.comment:
The shadow root of this shadow host.

Other resources

  • Shadow DOM 101 from HTML5Rocks.

  • Shadow DOM specification from W3C.

syntax.name: syntax
syntax.comment: Use to override the default syntax for polymer-elements. By default this will be null, which causes nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.instanceTemplate to use the template's bindingDelegate or the element.syntax, in that order.

xtag.name: xtag
xtag.comment:
Experimental support for web components. This field stores a reference to the component implementation. It was inspired by Mozilla's x-tags project. Please note: in the future it may be possible to extend Element from your class, in which case this field will be deprecated.

If xtag has not been set, it will simply return this nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.Element.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

addHostListeners.name: addHostListeners
addHostListeners.comment: Attach event listeners on the host (this) element.

append.name: append
append.comment:
Adds a node to the end of the child nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.nodes list of this node.

If the node already exists in this document, it will be removed from its current parent node, then added to this node.

This method is more efficient than nodes.add, and is the preferred way of appending a child node.

appendHtml.name: appendHtml
appendHtml.comment: Parses the specified text as HTML and adds the resulting node after the last child of this element.

appendText.name: appendText
appendText.comment: Adds the specified text after the last child of this element.

async.name: async
async.comment:
Invokes a function asynchronously. This will call Platform.flush() and then call window.requestAnimationFrame with the provided nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.async.method and return the result.

If you would prefer to run the callback after a given duration, see the nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.asyncTimer method.

If you would like to cancel this, use nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.cancelAsync.

asyncTimer.name: asyncTimer
asyncTimer.comment:
Invokes a function asynchronously. This will call Platform.flush() and then return a new Timer with the provided nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.asyncTimer.method and nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.asyncTimer.timeout.

If you would prefer to run the callback using window.requestAnimationFrame, see the nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.async method.

To cancel, call nuxeo_api_playground/dart-async.Timer.cancel on the result of this method.

attributeToProperty.name: attributeToProperty
attributeToProperty.comment: If attribute nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.attributeToProperty.name is mapped to a property, deserialize nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.attributeToProperty.value into that property.

bindProperty.name: bindProperty
bindProperty.comment:
Bind the nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.bindProperty.name property in this element to nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.bindProperty.bindable. Note in Dart it is necessary to also define the field:

var myProperty;

ready() {
  super.ready();
  bindProperty(#myProperty,
      new PathObserver(this, 'myModel.path.to.otherProp'));
}

cancelAsync.name: cancelAsync
cancelAsync.comment:
Cancel an operation scenduled by nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.async. This is just shorthand for:

window.cancelAnimationFrame(id);

classFollows.name: classFollows
classFollows.comment: Remove nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.classFollows.className from nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.classFollows.old, add class to nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.classFollows.anew, if they exist.

clone.name: clone
clone.comment:
Returns a copy of this node.

If nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.clone.deep is true, then all of this node's children and decendents are copied as well. If nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.clone.deep is false, then only this node is copied.

Other resources

  • Node.cloneNode from MDN.

contains.name: contains
contains.comment:
Returns true if this node contains the specified node.

Other resources

  • Node.contains from MDN.

createFragment.name: createFragment
createFragment.comment:
Create a DocumentFragment from the HTML fragment and ensure that it follows the sanitization rules specified by the validator or treeSanitizer.

If the default validation behavior is too restrictive then a new NodeValidator should be created, either extending or wrapping a default validator and overriding the validation APIs.

The treeSanitizer is used to walk the generated node tree and sanitize it. A custom treeSanitizer can also be provided to perform special validation rules but since the API is more complex to implement this is discouraged.

The returned tree is guaranteed to only contain nodes and attributes which are allowed by the provided validator.

See also:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.NodeValidator
  • nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.NodeTreeSanitizer

createShadowRoot.name: createShadowRoot
createShadowRoot.comment:
Creates a new shadow root for this shadow host.

Other resources

  • Shadow DOM 101 from HTML5Rocks.

  • Shadow DOM specification from W3C.

deliverChanges.name: deliverChanges
deliverChanges.comment: Synchronously deliver pending nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-observable.Observable.changes. Returns true if any records were delivered, otherwise false.

dispatchMethod.name: dispatchMethod
dispatchMethod.comment: Calls methodOrCallback with nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.dispatchMethod.args if it is a closure, otherwise, treat it as a method name in nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.dispatchMethod.object, and invoke it.

domReady.name: domReady
domReady.comment:
domReady can be used to access elements in dom (descendants, ancestors, siblings) such that the developer is enured to upgrade ordering. If the element definitions have loaded, domReady can be used to access upgraded elements.

To use, override this method in your element.

fetchTemplate.name: fetchTemplate
fetchTemplate.comment: Return a shadow-root template (if desired), override for custom behavior.

fire.name: fire
fire.comment: Fire a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.CustomEvent targeting nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.fire.onNode, or this if onNode is not supplied. Returns the new event.

getBoundingClientRect.name: getBoundingClientRect
getBoundingClientRect.comment:
Returns the smallest bounding rectangle that encompasses this element's padding, scrollbar, and border.

Other resources

  • Element.getBoundingClientRect from MDN.

  • The getBoundingClientRect() method from W3C.

getClientRects.name: getClientRects
getClientRects.comment:
Returns a list of bounding rectangles for each box associated with this element.

Other resources

  • Element.getClientRects from MDN.

  • The getClientRects() method from W3C.

getComputedStyle.name: getComputedStyle
getComputedStyle.comment:
The set of all CSS values applied to this element, including inherited and default values.

The computedStyle contains values that are inherited from other sources, such as parent elements or stylesheets. This differs from the nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.Element.style property, which contains only the values specified directly on this element.

PseudoElement can be values such as ::after, ::before, ::marker, ::line-marker.

See also:

  • CSS Inheritance and Cascade
  • Pseudo-elements

getDestinationInsertionPoints.name: getDestinationInsertionPoints
getDestinationInsertionPoints.comment:
Returns a list of shadow DOM insertion points to which this element is distributed.

Other resources

  • Shadow DOM specification from W3C.

getElementsByClassName.name: getElementsByClassName
getElementsByClassName.comment:
Returns a list of nodes with the given class name inside this element.

Other resources

  • getElementsByClassName from MDN.

  • DOM specification from W3C.

getNamespacedAttributes.name: getNamespacedAttributes
getNamespacedAttributes.comment:
Gets a map for manipulating the attributes of a particular namespace.

This is primarily useful for SVG attributes such as xref:link.

hasChildNodes.name: hasChildNodes
hasChildNodes.comment:
Returns true if this node has any children.

Other resources

  • Node.hasChildNodes from MDN.

insertAdjacentElement.name: insertAdjacentElement
insertAdjacentElement.comment:
Inserts nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentElement.element into the DOM at the specified location.

To see the possible values for nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentElement.where, read the doc for nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentHtml.

See also:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentHtml

insertAdjacentHtml.name: insertAdjacentHtml
insertAdjacentHtml.comment:
Parses text as an HTML fragment and inserts it into the DOM at the specified location.

The nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentHtml.where parameter indicates where to insert the HTML fragment:

  • 'beforeBegin': Immediately before this element.
  • 'afterBegin': As the first child of this element.
  • 'beforeEnd': As the last child of this element.

  • 'afterEnd': Immediately after this element.

    var html = '<div class="something">content</div>'; // Inserts as the first child document.body.insertAdjacentHtml('afterBegin', html); var createdElement = document.body.children0; print(createdElement.classes0); // Prints 'something'

See also:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentText
  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentElement

insertAdjacentText.name: insertAdjacentText
insertAdjacentText.comment:
Inserts text into the DOM at the specified location.

To see the possible values for nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentText.where, read the doc for nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentHtml.

See also:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertAdjacentHtml

insertAllBefore.name: insertAllBefore
insertAllBefore.comment:
Inserts all of the nodes into this node directly before refChild.

See also:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.insertBefore

insertBefore.name: insertBefore
insertBefore.comment:
Inserts all of the nodes into this node directly before refChild.

Other resources

  • Node.insertBefore from MDN.

installControllerStyles.name: installControllerStyles
installControllerStyles.comment: Installs external stylesheets and <style> elements with the attribute polymer-scope='controller' into the scope of element. This is intended to be called during custom element construction.

instanceTemplate.name: instanceTemplate
instanceTemplate.comment:
Creates the document fragment to use for each instance of the custom element, given the <template> node. By default this is equivalent to:

templateBind(template).createInstance(this, polymerSyntax);

Where polymerSyntax is a singleton nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.PolymerExpressions instance.

You can override this method to change the instantiation behavior of the template, for example to use a different data-binding syntax.

lightFromTemplate.name: lightFromTemplate
lightFromTemplate.comment: Utility function that stamps a <template> into light-dom.

marshalNodeReferences.name: marshalNodeReferences
marshalNodeReferences.comment: Locate nodes with id and store references to them in nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.$ hash.

matches.name: matches
matches.comment: Checks if this element matches the CSS selectors.

matchesWithAncestors.name: matchesWithAncestors
matchesWithAncestors.comment: Checks if this element or any of its parents match the CSS selectors.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

notifyChange.name: notifyChange
notifyChange.comment:
Notify observers of a change.

For most objects nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-observable.Observable.notifyPropertyChange is more convenient, but collections sometimes deliver other types of changes such as a nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-list_diff.ListChangeRecord.

Notes: - This is not required for fields if you mixin or extend nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.Observable, but you can use it for computed properties. - Unlike nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-change_notifier.ChangeNotifier this will not schedule nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-observable.Observable.deliverChanges; use nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-observable.Observable.dirtyCheck instead.

notifyPropertyChange.name: notifyPropertyChange
notifyPropertyChange.comment:
Notify that the field name of this object has been changed.

The nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.notifyPropertyChange.oldValue and nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.notifyPropertyChange.newValue are also recorded. If the two values are equal, no change will be recorded.

For convenience this returns nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.notifyPropertyChange.newValue.

notifyPropertyChanges.name: notifyPropertyChanges
notifyPropertyChanges.comment: Responds to property changes on this element.

offsetTo.name: offsetTo
offsetTo.comment:
Provides the offset of this element's nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.borderEdge relative to the specified nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.offsetTo.parent.

This is the Dart equivalent of jQuery's position method. Unlike jQuery's position, however, nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.offsetTo.parent can be any parent element of this, rather than only this's immediate nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.Element.offsetParent. If the specified element is not an offset parent or transitive offset parent to this element, an dart-core.ArgumentError is thrown.

onMutation.name: onMutation
onMutation.comment:
Returns a future when node changes, or when its children or subtree changes.

Use nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.MutationObserver if you want to listen to a stream of changes.

parseDeclaration.name: parseDeclaration
parseDeclaration.comment: Parse input <polymer-element> as needed, override for custom behavior.

polymerCreated.name: polymerCreated
polymerCreated.comment:
If this class is used as a mixin, this method must be called from inside of the created() constructor.

If this class is a superclass, calling super.created() is sufficient.

propertyForAttribute.name: propertyForAttribute
propertyForAttribute.comment: Return the published property matching name, or null.

query.name: query
query.comment: Alias for nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.querySelector. Note this function is deprecated because its semantics will be changing in the future.

queryAll.name: queryAll
queryAll.comment: Alias for nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.querySelectorAll. Note this function is deprecated because its semantics will be changing in the future.

querySelector.name: querySelector
querySelector.comment:
Finds the first descendant element of this element that matches the specified group of selectors.

nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.querySelector.selectors should be a string using CSS selector syntax.

// Gets the first descendant with the class 'classname'
var element = element.querySelector('.className');
// Gets the element with id 'id'
var element = element.querySelector('#id');
// Gets the first descendant [ImageElement]
var img = element.querySelector('img');

For details about CSS selector syntax, see the CSS selector specification.

querySelectorAll.name: querySelectorAll
querySelectorAll.comment:
Finds all descendent elements of this element that match the specified group of selectors.

nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.querySelectorAll.selectors should be a string using CSS selector syntax.

var items = element.querySelectorAll('.itemClassName');

For details about CSS selector syntax, see the CSS selector specification.

requestFullscreen.name: requestFullscreen
requestFullscreen.comment:
Displays this element fullscreen.

Other resources

  • Using the fullscreen API tutorial from WebPlatform.org.

  • Fullscreen specification from W3C.

requestPointerLock.name: requestPointerLock
requestPointerLock.comment:
Locks the mouse pointer to this element.

Other resources

  • Pointer lock and first person shooter controls tutorial from HTML5Rocks.

  • Pointer lock specification from W3C.

scheduleJob.name: scheduleJob
scheduleJob.comment:
Invoke nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.scheduleJob.callback in nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.scheduleJob.wait, unless the job is re-registered, which resets the timer. If nuxeo_api_playground/nx_xpath.NXXPath.scheduleJob.wait is not supplied, this will use window.requestAnimationFrame instead of a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-async.Timer.

For example:

_myJob = Polymer.scheduleJob(_myJob, callback);

Returns the newly created job.

scrollByLines.name: scrollByLines
scrollByLines.comment:
Scrolls the element by a number of lines.

Other resources

  • scrollByLines from WebPlatform.org.

scrollByPages.name: scrollByPages
scrollByPages.comment:
Scrolls the element by a number of pages.

Other resources

  • scrollByPages from WebPlatform.org.

scrollIntoView.name: scrollIntoView
scrollIntoView.comment:
Scrolls this element into view.

Only one of of the alignment options may be specified at a time.

If no options are specified then this will attempt to scroll the minimum amount needed to bring the element into view.

Note that alignCenter is currently only supported on WebKit platforms. If alignCenter is specified but not supported then this will fall back to alignTop.

See also:

  • scrollIntoView
  • scrollIntoViewIfNeeded

setInnerHtml.name: setInnerHtml
setInnerHtml.comment:
Parses the HTML fragment and sets it as the contents of this element. This ensures that the generated content follows the sanitization rules specified by the validator or treeSanitizer.

If the default validation behavior is too restrictive then a new NodeValidator should be created, either extending or wrapping a default validator and overriding the validation APIs.

The treeSanitizer is used to walk the generated node tree and sanitize it. A custom treeSanitizer can also be provided to perform special validation rules but since the API is more complex to implement this is discouraged.

The resulting tree is guaranteed to only contain nodes and attributes which are allowed by the provided validator.

See also:

  • nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.NodeValidator
  • nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.NodeTreeSanitizer

shadowFromTemplate.name: shadowFromTemplate
shadowFromTemplate.comment:
Utility function that creates a shadow root from a <template>.

The base implementation will return a nuxeo_api_playground/dart-dom-html.ShadowRoot, but you can replace it with your own code and skip ShadowRoot creation. In that case, you should return null.

In your overridden method, you can use nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.instanceTemplate to stamp the template and initialize data binding, and nuxeo_api_playground/polymer.Polymer.shadowRootReady to intialize other Polymer features like event handlers. It is fine to call shadowRootReady with a node other than a ShadowRoot such as with this.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
